snippet: The Labor Department said its price index fell 0.8 percent in January on plunging energy costs, pointing to benign inflation in the near term.
abstract: Labor Dept says Producer Price Index in January experienced largest decline in five years due to lower energy costs, which could bolster arguments against increasing interest rates; Commerce Dept reports housing starts fell by 2 percent in January; reports combined with others suggest United States economy is growing moderately early in first quarter.
lead_paragraph: The Labor Department said its price index fell 0.8 percent in January on plunging energy costs, pointing to benign inflation in the near term.

headline.main: Biggest Decline Since 2009 for Producer Price Index
headline.print_headline: Biggest Decline Since 2009 for Producer Price Index
